Detailed Description

template<typename T, typename Alloc = thrust::device_allocator<T>>
class thrust::device_vector< T, Alloc >

A device_vector is a Device Sequence that supports random access to elements, constant time removal of elements at the end, and linear time insertion and removal of elements at the beginning or in the middle. The number of elements in a device_vector may vary dynamically; memory management is automatic. The memory associated with a device_vector resides in the memory space of a parallel device.

Please refer to the C++ STL for the documentation of device_vector's API.

See also:
http://www.sgi.com/tech/stl/Vector.html

host_vector

Bug:
The following members do not exist yet: reverse_iterator, const_reverse_iterator, rbegin, rend, pop_back, insert, operator<.
